text: The Sceptical Chymist is a cornerstone book in the history of chemistry. It was written by Robert Boyle FRS (1627â€“1691). He was a 17th century natural philosopher, chemist, physicist, and inventor.Hunter, Michael 2000. Robert Boyle, 1627-91: scrupulosity and science. The Boydell Press.Hunter, Michael 2009. Boyle: between God and science. New Haven: Yale University Press. Boyle was an alchemist, but also the first modern chemist. He is famous for Boyle's law, which is about the relationship between the temperature and pressure of a gas. == References == Category:Science books Category:17th-century books Category:1660s works
